answers.answer: Dear Jeannie O:  There is no documented evidence that tamoxifen causes neuropathy.  It is well documented that tamoxifen may cause weight gain.  Likewise, it is well documented that diabetes can cause neuropathy.  You might consider seeing a neurologist to help assist with the neuropathy.

question: Does Tomaxafin cause neuroapathy?  I took this med for 12 years under the advice of my Dr.  He said "if it's not broken, don't fix it".  I have terrible neuroapathy and pain from my hip to my knee.  This started after taking it about 8 or 9 years.  I also gained about 40 lbs (after stopping it - lost 47!)  I have tingling and pins and needles also.  It is really starting to ruin my life!  I can hardly walk, and often use a cane.  Had an emg and was told it was from my diabetes.  My diabetes started about 6 years ago.  Please help me! Thanks, Jeannie
title: Tomaxifin Neurapathy
